articles.author: Kate Holton, Dan Burns
articles.description: Top U.S. and Chinese officials were due to meet in London on Monday for talks aimed at defusing the high-stakes trade dispute that has widened in recent weeks beyond tit-for-tat tariffs to export controls over goods critical to global supply chains.
articles.title: US and Chinese officials to meet in London for pivotal trade talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A vessel that was approaching Freedom Flotilla Coalition's Gaza-bound charity ship the Madleen has left, the coalition said early on Monday, after an alarm was sounded on the ship warning of a possible interception.
articles.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition says vessel approaching Gaza-bound ship left

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police declared all of downtown Los Angeles to be an unlawful assembly area and ordered protesters to go home after a third day of violence hit demonstrations against President Donald Trump's immigration policy.
articles.title: Los Angeles police order immigration protesters in downtown to go home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran will soon hand a counter-proposal in nuclear talks to the United States via Oman, Iranian foreign ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said on Monday, in response to a U.S. offer that Tehran deems "unacceptable".
articles.title: Iran to present a counter-proposal to U.S. in nuclear talks, foreign ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia hit Ukraine with its largest drone attack since the start of the war, the Ukrainian air force said.
articles.title: Russia launches biggest drone attack on Ukraine, targets military airfield, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte will use a speech in London on Monday to say the military alliance needs a 400% increase in air and missile defence, one of the priorities for a summit of members in the Hague later this month.
articles.title: NATO needs 400% increase in air and missile defence, Rutte will say in London

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has approved a new naval strategy which aims to fully restore Russia's position as one of the world's leading maritime powers, Kremlin aide Nikolai Patrushev said in an interview published on Monday.
articles.title: Putin approves big revamp of Russia's navy, Kremlin aide says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Monday that its forces had taken control of more territory in Ukraine's east-central region of Dnipropetrovsk, where the Kremlin said fighting was partly aimed at creating a "buffer zone."
articles.title: Russia says it takes more territory in east-central Ukraine, creating 'buffer zone' there

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Monday that Russia was still ready to honour agreements with Ukraine on a new prisoner of war exchange and on the repatriation of dead soldiers despite what it said was Kyiv's failure to so far honour its side of the bargain.
articles.title: Kremlin says Russia is still ready for prisoner swap with Ukraine despite problems

articles.author: Nicolás Misculin
articles.description: Argentina's firebrand right-wing President Javier Milei has largely tamed runaway inflation with a ruthless austerity plan and he aims to solidify power when his party and its allies take on a divided opposition in legislative elections in October.
articles.title: Argentine leader Milei licking his chops ahead of October elections
